LWG800N.name: Constitutional Law II
LWG800N.description: Procedure and substantive due process, equal protection, Bill of Rights, and Freedom of Expression.

LWG804.name: Antitrust Law
LWG804.description: How courts apply basic economic principles to business practice in a wide variety of industries.

LWG808B.name: Corporate Finance
LWG808B.description: Principles of accounting, valuation, and the basic financial environment of close corporations and public companies.

LWG811E.name: Labor and Employment Law
LWG811E.description: At-will employment relationship, terms and conditions of employment, and the application of the National Labor Relations Act as amended impacting collective bargaining units

LWG817A.name: Mortgage Finance
LWG817A.description: Legal issues in the mortgage-banking industry with a focus on residential property.

LWG817D.name: Evidence and the Expert Witness
LWG817D.description: Scientific and technical disciplines to the process of serving as an expert in a judicial proceeding.

LWG819.name: Partnership Tax
LWG819.description: Tax issues associated with form, term, liquidation, transfer and class problems.

LWG822.name: Products Liability
LWG822.description: Sources, development, and limitations of product liability.

LWG835B.name: Federal Law and Indian Tribes
LWG835B.description: Law and policy of the United States regarding Indian Tribes and their citizens.

LWG835D.name: American Indian Children and the Law
LWG835D.description: American Indian children and the law including the implementation, interpretation and understanding of the Indian Child Welfare Act (ICWA).

LWG835E.name: Tribal Law
LWG835E.description: Survey of the laws that tribes enact to govern themselves.

LWG835G.name: Global Perspectives on Indigenous Peoples
LWG835G.description: History, development, structure, content and efficacy of international human rights laws and norms that apply to indigenous peoples.

LWG835Q.name: Digital Humanities
LWG835Q.description: Legal and ethical issues implicated by the digital humanities research and resource-creation, including copyright, contract/licensing, privacy and other issues.

LWG837R.name: Artificial Intelligence and Law
LWG837R.description: How Artificial Intelligence (AI) interacts with law, how law and code to work together to regulate interactions among people and computers.

LWG837S.name: Automated Vehicles and the Law
LWG837S.description: Myriad of legal issues, including product liability, cybersecurity, privacy, insurance, criminal law and procedure, federal and state regulation, and patents. How discovery and evidentiary presentation at trial may be managed.

LWG837U.name: Evolutionary Analysis and Law
LWG837U.description: Basic computer techniques analyzing legal texts to measure similarity, sentiment, and perhaps influence, incorporating into law practice. Elucidating the cultural evolution of the common law.

LWG837V.name: Blockchain Technology, Law, and Policy
LWG837V.description: Laws affecting applications of the technology, and anticipated effects on contemporary legal practice.

LWG841B.name: Domestic Violence
LWG841B.description: Historical background of domestic violence. Understanding the nature of domestic violence, the prevention of domestic violence, and the survivor and batterer behavior.

LWG841F.name: Family Law: Child, Family and the State
LWG841F.description: Legal issues confronting families including marriage, parenthood, balancing work, domestic violence, adoption, and artificial insemination.

LWG841G.name: Immigration Law
LWG841G.description: Survey of United States immigration law emphasizing policy issues and issues that an attorney may encounter.

LWG841K.name: Juvenile Law
LWG841K.description: Laws related to juvenile courts, including juvenile delinquency, child neglect, jurisdiction, waivers, arrest, pretrial and trial.

LWG841V.name: Perspectives on U.S. Immigration Law
LWG841V.description: Immigration law and policy from a variety of perspectives, such as historical, social, public policy, economic, human rights, and legal perspectives.

LWG841W.name: Racial Justice-Legal and Societal Dimensions of Truth and Reconciliation
LWG841W.description: Racial justice in America, and exploring processes of truth and reconciliation that can help bring about the goals of racial healing and transformation.

LWG848E.name: International Environmental Law
LWG848E.description: Introduction to the use of bilateral and multilateral realities and other international mechanisms.

LWG848F.name: International Human Rights
LWG848F.description: Human rights and the international legal order, background, concepts, and the future.

LWG849F.name: Comparative Free Expression
LWG849F.description: Examination of approaches to free expression in a variety of different countries.

LWG851F.name: Free Speech on Campus
LWG851F.description: Free speech principles as they apply on the collect campus and creating a program for others to learn more about the First Amendment.

LWG858S.name: Biotechnology Law Seminar
LWG858S.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LWG858S.description: Impacts of biotechnology on legal topics that include intellectual property, business, federal regulations, property, criminal law and evidence, bioethics and international law.

LWG865A.name: Animal Law
LWG865A.description: Survey of animal legal issues including property status, zoning and cruelty.

LWG865C.name: Legal Issues with Energy Development and Wildlife
LWG865C.description: Emerging issues in energy law and policy relating to fish and wildlife.

LWG866D.name: Water Law
LWG866D.description: Water rights under the riparian doctrine and the prior appropriation system.

LWG866Q.name: Regulating Environmental Risk
LWG866Q.description: Regulatory responses to environmental and other risks to human life and health.

LWG872D.name: Tax Policy Seminar
LWG872D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LWG872D.description: Tax policy issues arising from federal taxation.

LWG879K.name: Law and Religion
LWG879K.description: Church/state law with special attention placed on legal doctrines under the Establishment Clause and Free Exercise Clause of the 1st Amendment.

LWG879R.name: Law and Interpretation
LWG879R.description: Judicial interpretation under the constitution, statutes and common law.

LWG891C.name: Negotiation
LWG891C.description: Introduction to the principles of negotiations. Multiple mock negotiations are required.

LWG893G.name: Consumer Law
LWG893G.description: Special legal requirements for consumer transactions.
